para.para.body: The orthogonal complement of a collection of vectors S in \RNr[n] consists of all those vectors in \RNr[n] which are perpendicular to every vector in S .

For example, the orthogonal complement of a single nonzero vector \Vect{n} in \RNr[n] consists of all those vectors \Vect{x} for which \DotPr{ \Vect{x} }{ \Vect{n} } = 0 . This, we recognize, is the hyperspace of vectors perpendicular to \Vect{n} .
The orthogonal complement of a single nonzero vector is always a hyperspace.
